bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Dr. and Mrs. Charles S. White, January 26, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks the Whites for hosting his family in Washington.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Dr. and Mrs. Charles S. White, January 26, 1942
div1.opener:
see Borden?
y f.
January 26, 1942
My dear Doctor and Mrs. White:
div1.p:
Mary and I were certainly delighted with the
courtesies which you extended to us in Washington. We
had such a pleasant dinner and evening with you. It
was grand to meet your find boy and girl. Mary and I
were especially impressed with the charm, poise and
personality of your daughter and voted that she was very
much all right!

It was so interesting to hear Dr. White's intimate
story of Walter Reed and I do hope, Dr. White, that you will
amplify the brief remarks that you sent me and will tell me
as much about the whole affair as possible--any little con-
versations you may have had with Reed, any remarks he might
have made in the operating room, etc. This all adds to the
human interest of the story which I hope to tell.

All in all, we had a grand Washington visit, to
the success of which you contributed greatly.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. Dr. and Mrs. Charles S. White
1420 Sixteenth Street N. W.
Washington, D. C.
